alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Dauphin; Lancaster; York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 5:47AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT LANCASTER...YORK...SOUTHEASTERN DAUPHIN AND EAST CENTRAL CUMBERLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 630 AM EDT... At 545 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lower Allen to near Middletown to York to 12 miles south of Dallastown. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, York, Lower Allen, Ephrata, Weigelstown, Elizabethtown, Columbia, Lititz, Middletown, Millersville, Camp Hill, Willow Street, Mount Joy, New Cumberland, Red Lion, Steelton, New Holland, Spry, Manheim and East Petersburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A 10 to 15 minute period of very heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding of poor drainage areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
